title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Autonomous System Obstacle Avoidance Control Design

context.prior_knowledge: Control theory, reinforcement learning basics, Python programming, and system dynamics comprehension
context.additional_context: Learners convert theory into practice using real-time simulation environments and digital devices, conducting case studies for application in corporate R&D settings

learning_goals: Learners will acquire the ability to mathematically model and implement reinforcement learning-based obstacle avoidance control algorithms
Learners will understand safety-critical trajectory generation methods by integrating barrier functions with infinite-horizon optimization problems
Learners will cultivate the ability to apply policy iteration learning and state-tracking approximation techniques based on actor-critic architectures
Learners will develop the ability to analyze system stability and weight convergence using Lyapunov methods
Learners will design controllers and perform simulations for linear/nonlinear systems (2D single integrators, unicycle kinematic systems)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
